title: Why should I become an alpha tester?
body: **I don't understand why anyone might want to sign-up for an under-tested client. What's the benefit? What makes me want to possibly encounter more bugs than usual? Comment if you can answer.**

replies.body: I signed up, because I love helping out companies test their new things.

@Meriipu I feel ya. Thats the spirit!

@Hinu Hyuga <3

I signed up because I wished to find out whether I could get it to run under wine on Linux

And how stable it is compared to the derpy air client

That was my thoughts I guess. Buncha bleeding hearts out there! :) Thanks for the comments. I suppose I have become entitled to tangible compensation for willing exposure to uncomfortable circumstances for the monetary benefit of others besides myself. How NA of me. Perhaps riot will show some gratitude towards those that were willing but I suppose there's always brown nosers out there that will pay to do it.
I just love having the newest and best stuff, and the new client is so cool :D

I love that I've been playing since early S2 and can have a voice in a company me and my friends have watched since it started up. It's just because it allows **you** to help make the game **you're** playing better** directly**, which doesn't happen very often. 

A few bugs and boarded up features is a small price to pay to help progress in any measure IMO.

I myself am a developer as well and like having people to test my work. I always try to help other developers finding bugs in their projects because i know how nasty finding bugs can be. The more people test this client the more stable the client will be afterwards.
And another reason: I like trying new software in general ^^
